Article.ArticleTitle: Enterovirus 71 3C proteolytically processes the histone H3 N-terminal tail during infection.

Abstract.AbstractText: • The N-terminal tail of histone H3 is specifically cleaved during EV71 infection. • Viral protease 3C is identified as a protease responsible for proteolytically processing the N-terminal H3 tail. • Our finding reveals a new epigenetic regulatory mechanism for Enterovirus 71 in virus-host interactions.
